meanings.sent1: The artist used auburns to paint the sunset.
meanings.sent2: Her hair had streaks of auburns that shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The auburns of the autumn leaves made them look like tiny flames.
meanings.sent4: The auburns of the old barn reminded him of his childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The auburns of the maple tree leaves in fall were breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Auburns (verb): to turn a reddish-brown color
meanings.sent1: Over time, the leaves auburns as autumn approached.
meanings.sent2: The hair dye will auburns her gray strands beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The apple started to auburns after being exposed to the sun for hours.
meanings.sent4: The sky began to auburns as the sun set on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The paint on the walls will auburns with age, giving the room a warm glow.

meanings.sent1: She wore a dress in auburns that matched her fiery personality.
